subject: Re: [junit] Learning ANT, JUnit - Compile Error: java.io.IOException:
msgSnippet: ... An ANT question, but what the hey ;-) ... Curious. I m guessing that you haven t set the environment variables ANT_HOME, JAVA_HOME, etc. In Windows, this
messageBody:
On Mar 31, 2005 7:36 PM, Clark I Anderson <anderci@...> wrote:
>
> I apologize that this is not specificaly a JUnit question. I cannot get
> to the JUnit task, yet.

An ANT question, but what the hey ;-)

>
> I am using 'JAVA Development with ANT', and 'JUnit Recipes', but I need
> additional help in my learning curve.
> Over this last year, I have seen excellent guidance on this forum.
>
> I will appreciate suggestions.
>
> Here are the first three tasks of the build.xml followed by the outputs:
>
> <?xml version="1.0"?>
> <project name="JunitDemoWithTests2" default="deploy" >
> <property name="HOME" value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Source" />
> <property name="SDKS_HOME" value="D:/JAVADevEnv/SDKs" />
> <property name="JAVA_HOME"
> value="D:/JAVADevEnv/SDKs/j2sdk-1_4_2_04-windows-i586" />
> <property name="CVSROOT" value="D:/JAVADevEnv/CVS" />
> <property name="TOOLS_HOME" value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools" />
> <property name="ANT_HOME"
> value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/apache-ant-1.6.2" />
> <property name="JUNIT_HOME"
> value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/JUnit/junit3.8.1" />
> <property name="CATALINA_HOME"
> value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.25" />
> <property name="HTTPUNIT_HOME"
> value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/HTTPUnit/httpunit-1.6" />
> <property name="MYSQL_HOME"
> value="D:/JAVADevEnv/Tools/mysql" />
> <target name="init">
> <mkdir dir="build/classes" />
> <mkdir dir="dist" />
> <echo>init complete!</echo>
> </target>
> <target name="test-init">
> <mkdir dir="test/classes" />
> <echo>test-init complete!</echo>
> </target>
>
> <target name="compile" depends="init,test-init">
> <javac fork="yes" srcdir="src" destdir="build/classes" >
> <classpath>
> <pathelement path="${JAVA_HOME}/bin" />
> <pathelement path="${JAVA_HOME}/lib" />
> <!-- <pathelement path="${ANT_HOME}/bin" /> -->
> <!-- <pathelement path="${ANT_HOME}/lib" /> -->
> <!-- <pathelement path="${CATALINA_HOME}/bin" /> -->
> <!-- <pathelement path="${MYSQL_HOME}/bin" /> -->
> <!-- <pathelement path="${JUNIT_HOME}/junit.jar" /> -->
> <!-- <pathelement
> location="${HTTPUNIT_HOME}/httpunit-1.6/lib/httpunit.jar"
> /> -->
> <!-- <pathelement
> location="${HTTPUNIT_HOME}/httpunit-1.6/jars/js.jar" />
> -->
> </classpath>
> </javac>
> <echo>compilation complete!</echo>
> </target>
> :
>

Curious. I'm guessing that you haven't set the environment variables
ANT_HOME, JAVA_HOME, etc. In Windows, this is done using the System
Properties | Advanced | Environment Variables dialog (I think - it's
been a while). Or you could just set them for an instance of the
command interpreter using set JAVA_HOME=some\path
Then you can reference them in an ant build.xml file using <property
environment="someprefix" /> and then have properties like
${someprefix.HTTPUNIT_HOME} - I think that this might be a more usual
way of referencing them.
